text:
In case you care, here are all the winners from Brit Awards 2017 
We have you covered in case you missed the action from Brit Awards 2017. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Mini Dixit A + A - 
Keeping up with the Awards season festivity, the Brit Awards 2017 were everything you'd expect them to be--musical, entertaining and glittery. 
One of the most important events for the British music industry, this year's big winners were David Bowie and Adele. 
While late music legend David Bowie, posthumously won two awards in the British male solo artist and Mastercard British Album categories, Adele, who wasn't present at the London event, accepted her Brits global success award on a giant screen. 
Here's the complete list of winners at the Brit Awards 2017: 
British male solo artist: David Bowie David Bowie won both British Male Solo Artist and Mastercard British Album Of The Year for ? at the BRITs tonight: https://t.co/nPuSkfTJfx pic.twitter.com/CwgaoE8Mpw â€” David Bowie Official (@DavidBowieReal) February 22, 2017 
British group: The 1975 
British female solo artist: Emeli Sande 
British group: The 1975 
Brits global success award: Adele 
Best single: Little Mix--Shout Out To My Ex 
Mastercard British Album: David Bowie--Blackstar 
International male solo artist: Drake 
International female solo artist: Beyonce 
International group: A Tribe Called Quest 
Best British video: One Direction-- History ?? @OneDirection win #BRITs British Video for the FOURTH year in a row!! @LiamPayne shouts out the devotion of 1D's fans ?? pic.twitter.com/UItb4FclXt â€” BRIT Awards (@BRITs) February 23, 2017 
With Katy Perry and Ed Sheeran in presence, how could the event not be musical? While Katy Perry took the stage and performed her new track Chained to the Rhythm, Sheeran performed two of his tracks that are dominating pretty much every playlist right now. Yes you guessed it right--Shape of You and Castle on the Hill. BEST performance of the night and i need the official remix omds???? @edsheeran @Stormzy1 #BRITs #BRITs2017 pic.twitter.com/Gb0IjGqH3Z â€” tee | 88 (@tareemax) February 22, 2017 
Other performers for the night included Little Mix, Coldplay and the Chainsmokers--whose new collaboration, Something Just Like This, made its debut--and Robbie Williams.
